citation.article-title: Xylanimonas cellulosilytica gen. nov., sp. nov., a xylanolytic bacterium isolated from a decayed tree (Ulmus nigra).
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Xylanimonas (Xy.lan.i.mo.nas. N.L. n. xylanum xylan, a polysaccharide; Gr. n. monas a unit; N.L. n. Xylanimonas a monad from xylan).
Aerobic or facultatively anaerobic, chemo-organotrophic and xylanolytic.
Optimal growth temperature is 30 °C; pH 7 is optimal for growth.
Oxidase is produced, but catalase production is weak.
Phylogenetically related to members of the family Promicromonosporaceae.
Cell-wall sugars are galactose and rhamnose.
Major menaquinones are MK-9(H4) and MK-8(H4); predominant fatty acid is anteiso-C15 : 0 (12-methyl tetradecanoic acid).
Contains phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylinositol, phosphatidylinositol mannosides and other unidentified phosphoglycolipids.
The type species of the genus is Xylanimonas cellulosilytica.
